{{Love table}}
 
{{Love table}}
 
'''Love''' represents a range of human [[emotion]]s and experiences related to the senses of [[affection]] and sexual attraction.<ref name="oxford">''Oxford Illustrated American Dictionary'' (1998) + ''Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary'' (2000).</ref> The word love can refer to a variety of different feelings, states, and attitudes, ranging from generic [[pleasure]] to intense [[interpersonal attraction]]. This diversity of meanings, combined with the complexity of the feelings involved, makes love unusually difficult to consistently define, even compared to other emotional states.
 
'''Love''' represents a range of human [[emotion]]s and experiences related to the senses of [[affection]] and sexual attraction.<ref name="oxford">''Oxford Illustrated American Dictionary'' (1998) + ''Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary'' (2000).</ref> The word love can refer to a variety of different feelings, states, and attitudes, ranging from generic [[pleasure]] to intense [[interpersonal attraction]]. This diversity of meanings, combined with the complexity of the feelings involved, makes love unusually difficult to consistently define, even compared to other emotional states.
  +   +
I bear a warning for all. Those with weak hearts, do not read on. There is a Smarty McSmartSmart in my school named Molly. Molly's smartness brings all the stalkers to the door. Molly doesn't know it, but two stalkers are madly in love with her. Bonnie and Megan are their names. These two creepos stalk her at lunch and sit wherever she sits. They stare at her when she's not looking. They also stalk her to the bathroom stalls and watch her. Don't get me started about what happens when Molly's asleep. You don't wanna know. Really. Please, be careful of lovestruck stalkers.
     
As an abstract concept ''love'' usually refers to a strong, [[ineffability|ineffable]] feeling towards another person. Even this limited conception of love, however, encompasses a wealth of different feelings, from the passionate desire and intimacy of [[romance (love)|romantic love]] to the nonsexual. Love in its various forms acts as a major facilitator of [[interpersonal relationship]]s and, owing to its central psychological importance, is one of the most common themes in the [[creative arts]].
